Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human GDF11 (growth differentiation factor 11) and MSTN (myostatin). Is predicted to have cytokine activity and transforming growth factor beta receptor binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including cellular response to cGMP; regulation of gene expression; and response to bacterium. Localizes to extracellular space. Is expressed in coelomocyte; head neurons; pharynx; and in male. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including Klippel-Feil syndrome (multiple); Loeys-Dietz syndrome (multiple); and bone disease (multiple).
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human BMPR1A (bone morphogenetic protein receptor type 1A) and BMPR1B (bone morphogenetic protein receptor type 1B). Exhibits BMP binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including defense response to other organism; nematode male tail tip morphogenesis; and positive regulation of macromolecule metabolic process. Is expressed in ASI; hypodermis; intestinal cell; pharynx; and tail. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including Loeys-Dietz syndrome (multiple); fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva; and hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia.
Location_evidence: wormbase; " Located in extracellular space," https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4540650/ "DAF-7/TGF-Î², which is most homologous to mammalian BMP and Drosophila DPP, is a neuroendocrine signal that is secreted from ASI chemosensory neurons in response to changes in environmental conditions"

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human FGF16 (fibroblast growth factor 16) and FGF20 (fibroblast growth factor 20). Exhibits growth factor activity; protein kinase binding activity; and transcription factor binding activity. Is involved in fibroblast growth factor receptor signaling pathway; nematode larval development; and regulation of cell projection organization. Localizes to cytoplasm; extracellular space; and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including CAN; OLL; cephalic sensillum; muscle cell; and pharyngeal cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including LADD syndrome; bone disease (multiple); and hypogonadotropic hypogonadism (multiple).
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human FLT1 (fms related receptor tyrosine kinase 1). Is predicted to have transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activity. Is involved in nematode male tail tip morphogenesis. Is expressed in intestinal muscle; intestine; and neuronal sheath cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including bone development disease (multiple); gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); and hematologic cancer (multiple).
Location_evidence: wormbase: let-756 is found in the cytoplasm;extracellular matrix and nuclear lumen. let-756 is expressed inCAN,OLL, cephalic sensillum,muscle cell and pharyngeal cells.

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human COL15A1 (collagen type XV alpha 1 chain) and COL18A1 (collagen type XVIII alpha 1 chain). Is involved in several processes, including cholinergic synaptic transmission; generation of neurons; and inductive cell migration. Localizes to basement membrane and cell junction. Is expressed in several structures, including basal lamina; head mesodermal cell; neurons; smooth muscle; and somatic nervous system.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human GPC1 (glypican 1) and GPC6 (glypican 6). Is involved in several processes, including epidermis morphogenesis; nematode larval development; and neuron migration. Is expressed in neuroblasts and ventral cord neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in Simpson-Golabi-Behmel syndrome type 1; nephroblastoma; and omodysplasia.
Location_evidence: wormbase: cle-1 is found in the extracellular space as a part of the basemement membrane to cells.

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human COL4A5 (collagen type IV alpha 5 chain) and COL4A6 (collagen type IV alpha 6 chain). Exhibits extracellular matrix structural constituent conferring tensile strength. Is involved in several processes, including embryo development; gonad morphogenesis; and regulation of distal tip cell migration. Localizes to collagen type IV trimer. Is expressed in several structures, including coelomocyte; egg-laying apparatus; rectal muscle; spermatheca; and tail.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human ITGB1 (integrin subunit beta 1). Is predicted to have integrin binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including mitochondrion organization; muscle cell cellular homeostasis; and positive regulation of cellular component organization. Localizes to several cellular components, including contractile fiber; focal adhesion; and lateral plasma membrane. Is expressed in egg-laying apparatus; enteric muscle; gonad; uterine epithelial cell; and vulval precursor cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in leukocyte adhesion deficiency 1.
Location_evidence: Wormbase: let-2 is located in the extracellular matrix and is expressed in the basement membrane. It is found to confer tensile strength

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human SERPINB11 (serpin family B member 11 (gene/pseudogene)). Is predicted to have serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Is involved in IRE1-mediated unfolded protein response. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including alpha 1-antitrypsin deficiency; alpha-2-plasmin inhibitor deficiency; and osteogenesis imperfecta (multiple).
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is predicted to have Wnt-activated receptor activity and Wnt-protein binding activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in familial hypercholesterolemia.
Location_evidence: wormbase: srp-7 is located in the extracellular matrix and enables serine-type endopeptidase activity

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human HSPA1B (heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 1B) and HSPA8 (heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 8). Exhibits ATPase activity. Is involved in determination of adult lifespan; response to heat; and retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Localizes to cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in germ line and intestine.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is predicted to have Wnt-activated receptor activity and Wnt-protein binding activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in familial hypercholesterolemia.
Location_evidence: uniprot: hsp-1 is located in the plasma membrane (https://www.uniprot.org/uniprotkb/P09446). wormbase: It is said to be involved in lifespan, retrograde transport endosome to golgi and heat response

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human COL13A1 (collagen type XIII alpha 1 chain). Is predicted to have extracellular matrix structural constituent. Is involved in axon guidance. Localizes to several cellular components, including extracellular space; neuromuscular junction; and spanning component of plasma membrane. Is expressed in anal depressor muscle; body wall musculature; hypodermis; neurons; and retrovesicular ganglion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in congenital myasthenic syndrome 19.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human DDR1 (discoidin domain receptor tyrosine kinase 1) and DDR2 (discoidin domain receptor tyrosine kinase 2). Is predicted to have collagen binding activity and protein tyrosine kinase collagen receptor activity. Is involved in motor neuron axon guidance and positive regulation of axon regeneration. Is expressed in hypodermis; intestinal muscle; nervous system; and pharynx.
Location_evidence: wormbase: col-99 is located in the extracellular matrix and neuromuscular junction. It is involved in axon guidance.

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human NTN1 (netrin 1). Is predicted to have signaling receptor binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including establishment or maintenance of actin cytoskeleton polarity; generation of neurons; and nematode male tail tip morphogenesis. Localizes to axon; basement membrane; and cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including P1; VA12; accessory cell; interneuron; and somatic neurons.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human DSCAM (DS cell adhesion molecule) and DSCAML1 (DS cell adhesion molecule like 1). Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including Compton-North congenital myopathy; MASA syndrome; and holoprosencephaly 11. Is predicted to encode a protein with the following domains: Fibronectin type III domain; Fibronectin type III; Immunoglobulin-like fold; Fibronectin type III superfamily; and Immunoglobulin-like domain superfamily.
Location_evidence: wormbase: unc-6 is found to be located in axon; basement membrane; and cytoplasm. It is expressed in several structures, including P1; VA12; accessory cell; interneuron; and somatic neurons.

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human NID1 (nidogen 1) and NID2 (nidogen 2). Exhibits extracellular matrix structural constituent. Is involved in several processes, including cholinergic synaptic transmission; nervous system development; and protein localization to synapse. Localizes to basal part of cell and basement membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including enteric muscle; gonad; labial sensillum; neurons; and vulval cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in Donnai-Barrow syndrome and familial hypercholesterolemia.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human PTPRD (protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type D) and PTPRF (protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type F). Is predicted to have transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine phosphatase activity. Is involved in several processes, including embryonic morphogenesis; nervous system development; and neuroblast migration. Localizes to adherens junction and synapse. Is expressed in embryonic cell; hypodermis; and nervous system.
Location_evidence: wormbase: nid-1 is located in the extracellular matix in the basal part of cell and basement membrane. It is expressed in several structures, including enteric muscle; gonad; labial sensillum; neurons; and vulval cell.

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human DHH (desert hedgehog signaling molecule); IHH (Indian hedgehog signaling molecule); and SHH (sonic hedgehog signaling molecule). Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including 46 XY gonadal dysgenesis; bone development disease (multiple); and holoprosencephaly 3. Is predicted to encode a protein with the following domains: Hint module; Ground-like domain; Hedgehog protein, Hint domain; Hint domain C-terminal; Hint domain N-terminal; Ground-like domain; and Hint domain superfamily.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human PTCH1 (patched 1) and PTCH2 (patched 2). Is predicted to have hedgehog family protein binding activity; hedgehog receptor activity; and smoothened binding activity. Is involved in molting cycle. Localizes to integral component of plasma membrane. Is used to study Parkinson's disease.

Exhibits PTB domain binding activity; SH2 domain binding activity; and protein kinase binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including dauer exit; regulation of cellular catabolic process; and regulation of gene expression. Localizes to several cellular components, including cytoplasmic vesicle; neuronal cell body; and spanning component of plasma membrane. Is expressed in amphid neurons; gonad; hypodermis; and nerve ring. Is used to study Parkinson's disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); hematologic cancer (multiple); and synostosis (multiple).
Location_evidence: worm base; disruption of gene impacts longevity: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17151440/

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Exhibits Notch binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including maintenance of dauer; positive regulation of stem cell proliferation; and regulation of vulval development. Localizes to cell projection membrane; integral component of plasma membrane; and neuronal cell body membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including distal tip cell; germ line; hypodermal cell; neurons; and vulval cell.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human NOTCH1 (notch receptor 1); NOTCH2 (notch receptor 2); and NOTCH3 (notch receptor 3). Exhibits RNA polymerase II transcription factor binding activity and transcription coactivator activity. Is involved in several processes, including maintenance of dauer; pharyngeal muscle development; and positive regulation of cell population proliferation. Localizes to several cellular components, including RNA polymerase II transcription factor complex; lateral plasma membrane; and spanning component of plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anus; germ line; neurons; somatic nervous system; and vulval precursor cell. Is used to study cancer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in several diseases, including Adams-Oliver syndrome; Alagille syndrome; and CADASIL 1.
Location_evidence: worm base; "The LAG-2 membrane protein is a putative signaling ligand for the LIN-12 and GLP-1": https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC305734/ FIXED BY AG

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is expressed in head; head mesodermal cell; non-striated muscle; somatic gonad precursor; and tail. Is predicted to encode a protein with the following domains: Delta serrate ligand; EGF-like domain; and Delta/Serrate/lag-2 (DSL) protein.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human NOTCH4 (notch receptor 4). Exhibits RNA polymerase II transcription factor binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including nematode larval development; oviposition; and positive regulation of mesodermal cell fate specification. Localizes to RNA polymerase II transcription factor complex and apical plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including body wall muscle cell from M lineage; gonadal sheath cell; somatic nervous system; vulval cell; and vulval precursor cell.
Location_evidence: worm base; "expression of arg-1 in different tissues is regulated distinctly and plays a unique role in the regulation": https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17369030/

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human BMP3 (bone morphogenetic protein 3) and GDF10 (growth differentiation factor 10). Exhibits signaling receptor binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including backward locomotion; cell morphogenesis; and inductive cell migration. Is expressed in several structures, including CAN; PDE socket cell; body wall musculature; cholinergic neurons; and terminal bulb.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human UNC5A (unc-5 netrin receptor A); UNC5B (unc-5 netrin receptor B); and UNC5C (unc-5 netrin receptor C). Exhibits netrin receptor activity and protein tyrosine kinase binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including establishment or maintenance of actin cytoskeleton polarity; generation of neurons; and nematode male tail tip morphogenesis. Localizes to axonal growth cone. Is expressed in several structures, including distal tip cell; excretory canal; head neurons; motor neurons; and somatic nervous system.
Location_evidence: wormbase; part of superfamily of secreted signaling molecules: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/9685266/

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human BMP10 (bone morphogenetic protein 10). Is predicted to have BMP receptor binding activity; cytokine activity; and protein serine/threonine kinase activator activity. Is involved in several processes, including defense response to other organism; nematode male tail tip morphogenesis; and positive regulation of macromolecule biosynthetic process. Is expressed in body wall musculature; nervous system; pm2 precursor; and in male. Is used to study Marfan syndrome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in situs inversus.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human LRIG1 (leucine rich repeats and immunoglobulin like domains 1); LRIG2 (leucine rich repeats and immunoglobulin like domains 2); and LRIG3 (leucine rich repeats and immunoglobulin like domains 3). Exhibits type I transforming growth factor beta receptor binding activity and type II transforming growth factor beta receptor binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including positive regulation of transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway; regulation of mesodermal cell fate specification; and transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway. Localizes to integral component of plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in congenital stationary night blindness 1F and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 1.
Location_evidence: wormbase; spatial and temporal mechanisms are critical for the DBL-1 signaling: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3479501/

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human BMP10 (bone morphogenetic protein 10). Is predicted to have BMP receptor binding activity; cytokine activity; and protein serine/threonine kinase activator activity. Is involved in several processes, including defense response to other organism; nematode male tail tip morphogenesis; and positive regulation of macromolecule biosynthetic process. Is expressed in body wall musculature; nervous system; pm2 precursor; and in male. Is used to study Marfan syndrome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in situs inversus.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Exhibits growth factor binding activity. Is involved in several processes, including negative regulation of transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway; regulation of mesodermal cell fate specification; and transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway involved in regulation of growth. Localizes to cell surface. Is expressed in hypodermis and intestine.
Location_evidence: wormbase; spatial and temporal mechanisms are critical for the DBL-1 signaling: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3479501/

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human LECT2 (leukocyte cell derived chemotaxin 2). Is involved in innervation; regulation of dendrite extension; and regulation of dendrite morphogenesis. Localizes to several cellular components, including cell surface; perikaryon; and sensory dendrite. Is expressed in body wall musculature; coelomocyte; head neurons; and ventral cord neurons.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Exhibits protease binding activity. Is involved in generation of neurons. Localizes to dendrite membrane. Is expressed in head neurons; mechanosensory neurons; somatic nervous system; and vulva. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in cornea plana.
Location_evidence: AG

Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human GRIN1 (glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit 1). Is predicted to contribute to NMDA glutamate receptor activity. Is involved in locomotory behavior and regulation of forward locomotion. Localizes to integral component of plasma membrane; neuron projection; and synapse. Is expressed in gonadal sheath cell and oocyte. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in autosomal dominant non-syndromic intellectual disability 8.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Exhibits protease binding activity. Is involved in generation of neurons. Localizes to dendrite membrane. Is expressed in head neurons; mechanosensory neurons; somatic nervous system; and vulva. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in cornea plana.
Location_evidence: wormbase; found in both extracellular space and adhered to plasma membrane: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gene/180350

R Function: DEG/ENaC channel (receptor of ECM mec proteins)
Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is predicted to have extracellular matrix structural constituent. Is involved in several processes, including detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; positive regulation of detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; and positive regulation of mechanosensory behavior. Localizes to extracellular matrix. Is expressed in head; hypodermis; muscle cell; tail; and touch receptor neurons.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human SCNN1B (sodium channel epithelial 1 subunit beta) and SCNN1G (sodium channel epithelial 1 subunit gamma). Exhibits ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Is involved in several processes, including detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; negative regulation of turning behavior involved in mating; and positive regulation of detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch. Localizes to axon; integral component of plasma membrane; and neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in touch receptor neurons. Is used to study hypokalemic periodic paralysis; ischemia; and neurodegenerative disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in bronchiectasis (multiple) and renal tubular transport disease (multiple).
Location_evidence: wormbase; made by the epidermal cells that surround the "touch cells": https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/8562083/#:~:text=elegans%20to%20respond%20to%20gentle,cells%20and%20two%20PVD%20neurons.

R Function: DEG/ENaC channel (receptor of ECM mec proteins)
Ligand_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is predicted to have extracellular matrix structural constituent. Is involved in several processes, including detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; positive regulation of detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; and positive regulation of mechanosensory behavior. Localizes to extracellular matrix. Is expressed in head; hypodermis; muscle cell; tail; and touch receptor neurons.
Receptor_desc_WormBase_versionWS277: Is an ortholog of human SCNN1A (sodium channel epithelial 1 subunit alpha); SCNN1B (sodium channel epithelial 1 subunit beta); and SCNN1G (sodium channel epithelial 1 subunit gamma). Exhibits ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Is involved in several processes, including detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; positive regulation of detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; and positive regulation of mechanosensory behavior. Localizes to cell body membrane. Is expressed in neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene are implicated in bronchiectasis (multiple) and renal tubular transport disease (multiple).
Location_evidence: wormbase; made by the epidermal cells that surround the "touch cells": https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/8562083/#:~:text=elegans%20to%20respond%20to%20gentle,cells%20and%20two%20PVD%20neurons.
